content.description: Starts below a scanty crack about eleven feet up.
content.protection: TR or a primarily free solo with carefully placed pro in one or two locations.

content.description: Start up steps on the left side of the main cliff, veering slightly left, and follow an obvious ridge/crack system upwards. At about 1/2-2/3 height, head out right on a big flake, and top out via the gap between the left wall and the prow of "Blackbeard" on the right.
content.protection:
BD sizes up to 3, mid-size Aliens in the upper half.   

  There are trees about 20-25 ft from the top, but at least one is not faring so well due to sling wear.  Gear options at the top of this one seem fairly limited.
content.location: When looking up from the bottom of the main cliff, look for the prominent, meandering line up the left side; the base of this climb is immediately left of the trail upon reaching the main cliff clearing.

content.description: What looks like it starts out to be a painful grunt in a chimney is actually a very fun layback.  Layback the chimney until it brings you to a “cave” then continue up the chimney at the top with one chimney move or stemming.

This is a clean, enjoyable climb with wide-open views. Begin just left of the prow (at top) of the cliff, and make a relatively straight path toward it.  About halfway up, climb over the bulge, avoiding the Starting Point crack on the left side and the Blackbeard crack on the right side.  Enjoy a look behind you over the lake before finishing up inside the prow. (Mind the loose chockstone below the bulge.)
content.protection: There are trees approx 20-25 feet from top. Limited options for gear anchors.
content.location: Approach the main cliff - southwest side of hill, easily identifiable by the A-Dawg graffiti (2013) -  by the red arrow trail, which passes just along the base.  To access the top, pass right of the cliff and take the left turnoff (1-2 mins past cliff.)  This climb is on left end of the main cliff between the "Starting Point" and "Blackbeard" crack systems.  Look up for the prominent prow that marks the top of all 3 climbs.

climbs.name: Porcelain Arete
climbs.fa: (solo) Chris Czapla FA  late 1980s (lead) Ken Nichols, 1991

content.description: Routes goes up the arete on the right of the main wall.
content.protection: Long webbing or static for less than ideal top rope set up off trees. BD #4 and #3 can also be used.
content.location: Follow trail along base of the cliffs. After maybe a 20 minute hike you will be at the wall. Route is on the obvious arete right of graffiti.

content.description: Climb the right leaning crack up to a stance under an overhang. Leave the crack by climbing up and slightly left to gain a vertical crack that leads straight up into a left facing corner. Finish straight up the face above.
content.protection: This climb is runout on relatively easy ground between the 2 crack systems but otherwise protects well with small to medium cams and large nuts.
content.location: Same start as Black Jack Crack, about 10 ft right of Porcelain Arete at an obvious right leaning crack system.

content.description: A relatively enduring route that starts to the right of Black Beard and finishes towards the right.
Look for the hand crack just left of the arete.  Crimp your way to the top. The crux occurs as you're working past the bottom 1/3 as the holds may not be directly obvious at first.
content.protection: TR anchor on sad trees at the top. Bolts would be ideal.

content.description: The obvious right leaning jam crack to the right of the Porcelain Arete, then up a left leaning crack and finish straight up the face.
content.protection: Takes mostly cams. Doubles if you really wanted to sew it up.
content.location: Same start as Milky Way, but continue up the right leaning crack.

content.description: A great climb right off the trail and probable the tallest climb at Latern Hill.  Enjoy the views of the pond from up top.
content.protection: Standard Rack - No Fixed Gear or Anchors - Long Webbing or Static Rope From Trees For Toperope
content.location: Main Face directly below the left facing corner the forms highest point of the cliff.  A route called Sharper Image is to the left and the route called Jolly Roger is to the right.

content.description: Climb straight up the face between the Porcelain Arete and Milky Way. Exit up over the roof at the top. Also known as The Bulge Problem.
